Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2013 08:03PM - edited Feb 11, 2013 08:04PM by ccommer Just thought I wold chime in. I just had mammo, called back for second look with diagnostic mammo and ultrasound. What showed up is an area of focal asymmetry...shows on mammo but not on ultrasound. Oh and can not feel lump. I think with you they went right to ultrasound cuz of your age and density. But must be frustrating that it is not showing up. I am now going for MRI, they wanted to biopsy but with the imaging difficulties, this is the next step for me. Hope they figure something out for you.
Posts.Title: New...lump unseen on ultrasound. LYCM85 bdavis

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2013 12:03AM ccommer wrote: read my post---back in wondering waiting phase....as i had suspicious mammo, 2nd mammo, ultrasound, all set for biopsy, and then off to mri----all for the right breast.  and what they found there is the right is no longer the offender, but wait...the left has the issues. i am now being referred to a breast specialist/surgeon.  i also work in healthcare and am guilty of trying to analyze every descriptive word of a report, alot because it is interesting, as i am really not that worried, but i do want to know. anyway i guess my point it , we just do not know untill a biopsy is done or we are able to really sit down and discuss this, rather than speculate.  good luck--- chris
